column4: what's the likelyhood that this bug will be fixed anytime soon?... https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/gvfs/+bug/212789
i think it's amazing that they would let such a piece of crap go out the door
this is a support channel. Rants in /dev/null please
i'm trying to get support
ranting won't help with that
try once more, haven't seen your question yet
something is going haywire with the ~/.gvfs folder...
'interesting'
it's a completely fresh install, too
it's apparently partially fixed in hardy-proposed (the segfault): https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/gvfs/+bug/212789/comments/12
i have proposed enabled and i haven't seen any updates
well, there's not much people in here can help you with. The available workarounds are posted in that bug
(those updates don't fix the logout+login problem, so don't wet yerself yet)
I would like to suggest that you read the guidelines. People in here tend to be very strict about them because of the heavy traffic. They may help you understand why you were reprimanded. Thanks!
that bugreport has some confirmations already. There's not much we in here can help you with
i'm assuming the more people that see it, the more serious it will be taken. i know i'm not going to get a solution here, i'm just wondering if most people are seeing it
... purely out of curiosity at this point
fair enough :) But this is a support channel, not a devel/testers channel. It's busy enough here already just helping people
give me a better place to ask, and i'll do so
try #ubuntu-offtopic, they're into anything. Just tell them I sent you and if they don't help/test it for you they'll be whacked :)
i'll try that, thanks
yeh, no help in offtopic either... let the skull thumping commence! :)
